long: Meaning: properly, to "touch", i.e. "lay the hand upon" (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to "reach" (figuratively, to "arrive", "acquire"); violently, to "strike" (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.).  Usage: beat, (Ã— be able to) bring (down), cast, come (nigh), draw near (nigh), get up, happen, join, near, plague, reach (up), smite, strike, touch.  Source: a primitive root;
